definition: to fit/suitable/proper/just (now)/comfortable/well/to go/to follow or pursue
definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]

sentences.english: SamuelLing, The Meaning and ContemporarySignificance Confessing the Inerrancy of Scripture Today.
sentences.chinese: 林慈信，《认信圣经无误的重要性和当今适切性》。

sentences.english: The model embodied a kind of harmony of progressiveness and appropriateness.
sentences.chinese: 这种教育范式体现了先进性与适切性的统一。

sentences.english: Learn the rules so you know how to break them properly.
sentences.chinese: 先弄懂规则，才会知道该如何适切地打破成规。

sentences.english: Each individual should appropriate medical treatment and being respected.
sentences.chinese: 每一个人应该受到尊重和适切的治疗。

sentences.english: Thus, it is highly demanded to propose a corresponding scheme to adaptively maintain the background.
sentences.chinese: 因此，背景模型需要适切的技术维持背景的适应性。

sentences.english: Thus appropriate interpreting of situations and sense of self are lost.
sentences.chinese: 因此对情况适切的解释及自我感丧失了。

sentences.english: The life of which it is an expression will guide it.
sentences.chinese: 那赋予它表达方式的生命将给予适切的导航。

sentences.english: For its realistic and colorful depiction of life, that is appropriate and unfeigned.
sentences.chinese: 捕捉真实生活的色彩，适切而不做作。

definition: to respond accordingly to/to adapt to/to cope with
to adapt (to an environment etc)/to make sth suitable/adaptation/adjustment/adaptive
in order that/so that/so as to/to cause sth
